Description: Rim and neck sherd of Attic black-figured pottery volute-krater; interior glazed black with added red band at rim; top of rim reserved; on exterior key maeander; on neck black-figure frieze: on left, heads of two horses of team to right; two warriors to left confront a third (each in short chiton, fully armed with Corinthian helmet, spear raised in right hand, shield on left arm; warrior facing left is probably shown in back view; middle warrior has round shield, other two have Boeotian shields; red on helmet crests, on edges of Boeotian shields, dots on edge of round shield; faded added white for thunderbolt device on right-hand shield and on fittings and straps of shields seen from inside); shield of fourth hoplite to right; neck glazed below.
Curator's comments: The sherd possibly belongs to the same vase as British Museum 1965,0930.851.
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B600.35)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 285, no. B254)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0175) (Phase 1)
